card.name: Using the Cards
entries: The cards on this page are meant to be photocopied and given to players whose characters win {@deck Medals of Merit|CRCotN} in {@adventure chapter 1|CRCotN|1} (see that chapter for contest rules).

The cards in {@adventure appendix D|CRCotN|11} are meant to be given to players whose characters gain {@deck Fragments of Suffering|CRCotN} in {@adventure chapter 6|CRCotN|6} (see that chapter for more information).

card.name: Axeholm
entries: Embedded in a mountain south of Phandalin is the ancient dwarven fortress of Axeholm, which has been sealed for years. If a dragon attack is imminent, the people of Phandalin can evacuate and take refuge in Axeholm. To that end, someone needs to open the fortress and make it safe for habitation. Once you accomplish these tasks, return to Townmaster Wester to collect a reward of 250 gp.

card.name: Butterskull Ranch
entries: Orcs have attacked Butterskull Ranch, five miles east of Conyberry along the Triboar Trail! Travel there with haste, assess the damage, and help any way you can. Alfonse Kalazorn, the ranch owner, is a retired sheriff who can reward you for your efforts. If he's dead, return to Townmaster Harbin Wester with proof of Kalazorn's demise to receive a reward of 100 gp.

card.name: Dragon Barrow
entries: The dragon that besets us is not the first to threaten this region. Between here and Neverwinter lies the barrow mound of a warrior whose magical dragon-slaying sword helped fell a green dragon terrorizing the High Road a century ago. Rumor has it the {@item dragon slayer} sword is buried there, too. Retrieve it, and let the sword be its own reward!

card.name: Dwarven Excavation
entries: Dwarf prospectors found ancient dwarven ruins in the mountains southwest of here and have begun an archaeological dig for treasure and relics. They need to be warned that a white dragon has moved into the area. Take the warning to them, then return to Townmaster Harbin Wester to collect a reward of 50 gp.

card.name: Gnomengarde
entries: A clan of reclusive rock gnomes resides in a small network of caves in the mountains to the southeast. The gnomes of Gnomengarde are known for their magical inventions. They might have something with which to defeat the dragon. Get whatever you can from them. If you bring back something useful and don't want to keep it for yourselves, Townmaster Harbin Wester will pay you 50 gp for it.

card.name: Loggers' Camp
entries: Deep in Neverwinter Wood, along the river that flows west toward Neverwinter, is a logging camp. Every two months, Phandalin delivers fresh supplies to the camp, which is run by the half-brother of Phandalin's townmaster, Harbin Wester. Barthen, the local provisioner, has prepared a new delivery. He needs someone to bear the supplies safely to the camp. Return to Harbin Wester with a notice of delivery signed by his half-brother, Tibor Wester, to claim your reward of 100 gp.

card.name: Mountain's Toe
entries: The Mountain's Toe Gold Mine lies fifteen miles northeast of Phandalin. The new overseer, Don-Jon Raskin, just made the trip from Neverwinter to Phandalin and needs to be escorted to the mine. There's no telling what dangers lie between here and there. Once you deliver Raskin safe and sound, return to Townmaster Harbin Wester to collect a reward of 100 gp.

card.name: Umbrage Hill
entries: The local midwife—an acolyte of {@deity Chauntea|Faernian|SCAG} named Adabra Gwynn—lives by herself in a stone windmill on the side of a hill a few miles south of Phandalin. With dragon sightings becoming common, it's not safe for her to be alone. Urge Adabra to return to Phandalin. Once she's safe, visit Townmaster Harbin Wester to claim a reward of 25 gp.

card.name: Woodland Manse
entries: The orcs have fallen under the sway of evil spellcasters in Neverwinter Wood and have been sighted in growing numbers near Falcon's Hunting Lodge. The spellcasters dwell in a ruined manse. Falcon needs someone to make a preemptive strike against it. Destroy the evil in the manse, then expect him to reward you.

card.name: Agdon Longscarf the Harengon
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

This harengon brigand is an insufferable braggart and a daring thief who's willing to put himself in seemingly precarious situations when he has an audience, confident that his speed and cunning will see him through danger. He leads by example rather than by dictate.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic evil.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "Responsibility isn't really my thing."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "What's yours is mine; it's only a matter of time."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I have a reputation to uphold. I can't have it sullied by silly concepts like honesty and generosity."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "My confidence is bound up in my scarf's powers. I'm quite the coward without it."

card.name: Alagarthas the Elf Prince
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON
This prince made a bargain with Endelyn Moongrave and is paying the price. He longs to return to his home in the Misty Forest and deal with the threat of an evil green dragon that nests there.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I am an elf, and time is on my side. I refuse to give up—ever."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "The elves of the Misty Forest will lose their homes and likely perish if that green dragon isn't slain or driven off. I shall deal with the dragon before it visits great harm on the forest and my people. That is what a prince is expected to do."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Ah, the Misty Forest! No other wood compares to it in beauty and serenity."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "To relent is to show weakness, and I shall not be seen as weak. It is my destiny to be king."

card.name: Amidor the Dandelion
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON
This 3-foot-tall talking dandelion finds poetry in everything and is quick to fall head over heels in love. A humble idealist, Amidor never puts its own needs above the needs of others.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "My speech drifts into flowery verse, if you'll pardon the pun. Allow me to demonstrate: Do not cry, my love! Let me catch your tears as faeries collect morning dew. Let me lift your spirits like a seed on the breeze!"

items.name: Ideal
entries: "The pursuit of true love compels me! Never shall I wilt if I have such a cause to champion."

items.name: Bond
entries: "The beautiful Pollenella—a vision in stripes."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I cannot resist a pretty face or a heavenly scent."

card.name: Argantle the Korred Queen
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON

Queen Argantle sports a generous beard and whiskers. Her hair is shorn on one side, from where Endelyn Moongrave recently snipped off the queen's precious, powerful locks. Argantle wears an abundance of shale jewelry that doesn't seem to weigh her down in the least.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "My mood is as stormy as the skies of Yon, and I hurl boulders when I'm angry."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Bitter End is a raving tyrant. I live in hope that one day we'll be free of that hag."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I have sworn to protect Lockbury Henge, and I'll defend it with every last whisker."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I am quick to make enemies and slow to make friends."

card.name: Burly the Bugbear
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Burly and his brother, Hurly, joined the carnival as youngsters. Hurly disappeared a few months ago, and search parties failed to locate him. Mister Witch and Mister Light convinced Burly to stay with the carnival afterward, rather than continue the search on his own. When he's not straining at some feat of athleticism, he's reading books of poetry.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I treat my brain like a muscle and try to keep it strong."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I keep the peace. I don't advocate violence; I'm just doing my job."

items.name: Bond
entries: "After my brother disappeared, everyone in the carnival was so nice to me. I look out for them."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "Sometimes I forget my own strength and accidentally break things. Especially fragile things."

card.name: Candlefoot the Mime
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Candlefoot's appearance is strangely monochromatic, due to the chaotic magic of a reckless sorcerer to whom he was apprenticed in his youth. After fleeing his master, Candlefoot found a home in the Witchlight Carnival. He can communicate only through mime until his stolen voice is retrieved from the kenku warlock, Kettlesteam.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I shrug a lot because I'm indecisive."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Love has the power to conquer all."

items.name: Bond
entries: "My true love, Palasha, means everything to me. I'd live my life's misfortunes a hundred times over if I knew the path that would lead me back to her."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm afraid of my own reflection and avoid looking into mirrors. The Hall of Illusions terrifies me."

card.name: Chucklehead the Goblin
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Chucklehead's real name is Fug. He has a strong affection for Mishka (the only child in Loomlurch who doesn't fear or mock him) and treats her like a younger sibling. He resists any attempt to remove the maggot that lives in his head, because he fears losing it might turn him back into the uncaring, self-serving person he was previously.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral (neutral evil without the maggot).

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I get angry when people make fun of my head."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Not all goblins are the same. I mean, look at me."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Mishka is like my little sister. I don't like how Granny Nightshade treats her."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "The maggot showed me my true self. I'll always love it for that, even as it eats my head."

card.name: Clapperclaw the Scarecrow
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

Despite the loss of its original head, this child-sized scarecrow retains an upbeat demeanor characterized by its affinity for gallows humor. With its long claws and rattling gourd head, Clapperclaw knows it can be off-putting to strangers, and it relies on humor to defuse tension.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I'm generally positive, and I make jokes when I'm nervous or sense tension in the air."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I prefer to keep moving from place to place."

items.name: Bond
entries: "My original head. It was perfect every way. I hope to get it back one day."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm self-conscious about my replacement head."

card.name: Cradlefall the Green Dragon Wyrmling
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Granny Nightshade reared Cradlefall from an egg, but the hag's alchemical incubation processes stunted the dragon's growth, making him small even for a wyrmling. Cradlefall is Granny Nightshade's most loyal servant—a slithering parcel of cruelty that's never far from her side.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful evil.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I hiss when I speak and slink around whomever I'm talking with."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Terror is the best teacher, and frightened children make the best workers."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Skabatha Nightshade is my true, loving mother. I must honor and protect her."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "My words are laced with veiled threats, even when I'm pretending to be nice."

card.name: Dirlagraun the Displacer Beast
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Dirlagraun was raised by a noble high elf family of the Summer Court and blessed with the ability to speak and understand Common and Sylvan. The displacer beast adores the company of children and served as a nanny to the family's children.
Dirlagraun's own offspring, a kitten named Star, went missing a few weeks ago.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "My tentacles flick in the air when my guard is up."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Nurture the young, for they are the bright lights of tomorrow."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I'm duty-bound to protect the young guests of the Witchlight Carnival."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't forgive myself for the disappearance of my cub, Star."

card.name: Gleam the Elf Acrobat
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON

Gleam is blessed with kindness, grace, and the power of moonlight. She wears a crescent moon mask and is one-half of an acrobatic duo called the Selenelion twins, alongside Glister, her sunny twin. Gleam wants to reunite with her twin and return to the Witchlight Carnival, where they belong.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I'm shy except when I'm on stage or under the Big Top."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Everyone should be free to express themselves however they wish."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I love my twin, Glister, with all my heart. I feel incomplete without her."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I avoid conflict. Even a simple argument leaves me flustered and longing to be elsewhere."

card.name: Glister the Elf Acrobat
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON

Glister is blessed with confidence, grace, and the power of the sun. She wears a sun mask and is one-half of an acrobatic duo called the Selenelion twins, alongside Gleam, her shy twin. Glister is content to remain Endelyn's "guest" in Motherhorn if it means her sibling is safe from the hag's wickedness.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I like to play with fire. I'm confident and take risks, even when the odds are stacked against me."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Everyone should be free to express themselves however they wish."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I would sacrifice everything to protect my twin."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "When I'm not the center of attention, I become sullen and moody."

card.name: Hurly the Bugbear
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON

Hurly's brusque nature and short temper made life in the Witchlight Carnival hard for him. His prickly demeanor stems from the fact that he lacks the talent to be what he wants to be: an entertainer. Mister Witch and Mister Light gave him menial jobs because they knew his limitations. By allowing him to perform in her theater, Endelyn Moongrave confirmed what Hurly knew to be true: that Witch and Light were right all along.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "If 'dumb brute' is the only role I can play well, I guess that's what I'll be."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "People might pretend to care about you, but when the play is over, they show you their true selves, and it's never pretty."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I miss my brother."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm quick to lose my temper."

card.name: Jingle Jangle the Goblin
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

Jingle Jangle is a kind soul who refers to herself in the third person. She has a knack for finding keys and is thrilled to add new ones to her collection. She also gives keys as gifts to those who need them.
Jingle Jangle seeks a quiet life far away from locked doors and the intrigues of the fey courts. She moved to Telemy Hill to enjoy the hill's companionship and protection.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "Jingle Jangle is thorough and fastidious. No cutting corners."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Revel in your uniqueness, whether you're a goblin who likes keys or an awakened hill with talking trees."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Jingle Jangle keeps her keys shiny and clean."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "Jingle Jangle is frightened by locked doors!"

card.name: Kettlesteam the Kenku
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Kettlesteam delights in causing trouble at the carnival. She uses a combination of mimicry and conjured illusions to communicate; she has overheard so many conversations that she can talk in one of several different voices.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I'm stubborn as a dog gnawing a bone (mimics the sound of a dog gnawing a bone)."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Malicious joy. I can't help but chuckle when people mess up (mimics the sound of someone stumbling and others laughing)."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I have a fey pact with Zybilna of Prismeer (mimics the sound of the wind blowing through willows and faraway tinkling bells)."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I have a volatile temper (mimics the sound of a kettle boiling over)."

card.name: Mister Light
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL
Mister Light is the face of the Witchlight Carnival. He's a loud, flamboyant ringleader who'll do anything to maintain the carnival's happy atmosphere.
Mister Light wears a harlequin suit and a jaunty hat. When he presides over the carnival's Big Top, he sparkles like a disco ball.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "There's always something for me to smile about."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Delight. I want everyone to feel the wonder that I feel each day in this place."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Mister Witch is my greatest friend and most trusted confidant."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I was the crueler of the two of us, long ago. Perhaps that streak of violence hasn't quite left me."

card.name: Mister Witch
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL
Mister Witch is businesslike and humorless as he deals with staff and keeps the carnival running on schedule. A smile on his visage is a rare event, and it fades quickly.
Mister Witch dresses with panache, though in muted tones, and always carries his magic pocket watch.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I carefully consider my words before speaking them aloud."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Caution. Thoughtless decisions lead to reckless acts."

items.name: Bond
entries: "This carnival is our opportunity for a new life, far away from the gloomy world we came from."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm too confident in my own authority to see the seeds of doubt in the carnival staff."

card.name: Morgort the Bullywug Knight
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

The Knight of Warts is known for her skill at piloting balloons. Justice and moral clarity guide her every action. Despite being held prisoner for treason, she claims that her honor remains intact. Even if it means losing her title, she refuses to bow to King Gullop XIX or renounce her friend and companion, Wigglewog, with whom she conspired to help Sir Talavar escape Bavlorna's clutches.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I spit whenever I hear a coward or a liar speak."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Honor is what makes a knight, even beyond duty or prowess with a weapon."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Ballooning. There's nothing quite like taking flight in a balloon and going where the winds take you."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm a snob who criticizes the state and quality of weapons wielded by others."

card.name: Nib the Miser
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Nib (whose real name is Meryl Caberstock) is a tall, rake-thin, elderly man dressed in threadbare finery and a housecoat. He wears a blindfold to avoid glimpsing the apparitions that curse him, but their presence still unnerves him.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I speak in a trembling voice and jump at the slightest shadow."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I seek atonement. I was the worst of Waterdeep's slumlords: ruthless, miserly, and coldhearted. I suppose I'd better do some good before I die."

items.name: Bond
entries: "My spinning wheel is the key to my redemption."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "Yes, I'm scared. If you'd done all the things I've done, you'd be scared too."

card.name: Northwind the Treant Sapling
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Northwind embodies the joys of spring, finding childlike wonder in everything from a story told by a stranger to a drop of morning dew. The sapling hails from a line of Feywild treants and travels as the Witchlight Carnival's landscaper, laying down silk ribbons to form rivers and planting acorns that grow rapidly into splendid oak trees.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I love to hear stories. Tell me everything!"

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Joy. Just look at the world around us! Isn't it amazing?"

items.name: Bond
entries: "My ancestors. One day I will grow into an enormous tree and they will be so proud!"

items.name: Flaw
entries: "Oops! I simply cannot keep a secret."

card.name: Palasha the Mermaid
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Palasha is an elegant and operatic mermaid whose long fins billow even when she's not underwater. She sculpts water with her extraordinary voice, creating astounding displays of aquatic magic. Palasha's distant yet demanding nature has earned her a reputation for being haughty, but really, she's just slow to trust.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I click my fingers at those around me when I want something."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I strive to bring beauty and wonder into this world with the power of my voice."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Candlefoot. I can be myself around him."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I have trouble showing my true feelings, which makes me seem aloof."

card.name: Pincushion the Living Doll
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Pincushion is Skabatha Nightshade's childhood doll—an animated nanny brought to life by Baba Yaga to help educate Skabatha. The doll's magic has kept it well preserved, despite its great age. Granny Nightshade has put Pincushion in charge of producing fabric for her toy workshop—a job the doll considers beneath it.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral evil.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I behave like the conceited mistress of a high-society fashion house."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I want Skabatha to respect all I've done for her."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Nobody knows more about fashion than I do."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I crave flattery."

card.name: Shon the Hunchback
entries: CHAPTER 5: PALACE OF HEART'S DESIRE
Shon knows that Zybilna is the archmage Iggwilv in a new form—a change for the better, in his estimation. He would never cross Zybilna, to whom he owes his career.
Shon and his "hump" (a {@creature giant wolf spider|MM} named Gray that rides on Shon's back) are never apart for very long.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I like books more than people."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Knowledge is a great thing, but not in the hands of imbeciles and bullies. Knowledge must be protected from those who would abuse it."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I look after Gray, and Gray looks after me."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "If you're put off by my abrasiveness, know that I couldn't care less. I don't need any more friends."

card.name: Sir Talavar the Faerie Dragon
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

Sir Talavar is an esteemed member of the Seelie Court and a loyal vassal of the Summer Queen. Many of Sir Talavar's squires have gone on to become knights of great renown. The venerable faerie dragon has an encouraging, can-do demeanor and an unwavering sense of honor.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "My speech is riddled with references to adventures I have undertaken."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "A little kindness goes a long way."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I am but a humble vassal of Her Magnificence, the Summer Queen."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "My knightly oaths are tested most strongly by my craving for hard candy."

card.name: Sowpig the Ghoul
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL & CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Skabatha Nightshade encountered this small ghoul while collecting grave dust in a cemetery on the Material Plane. The hag brought Sowpig to Loomlurch and fed her bowls of carrion. Sowpig lures children from the Witchlight Carnival into the hag's clutches so that Granny Nightshade can put them to work in her toy shop.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic evil.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I tend to stand silently, staring and saying nothing."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Children need work to keep them out of trouble. Those toys aren't going to make themselves."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I serve Granny, who made me what I am today. I would never betray her."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm a soulless husk incapable of remorse."

card.name: Squirt the Oilcan
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Originally a nonsentient oilcan, Squirt was carried to the Feywild by dwarves hoping to harvest boggle oil. Though the expedition was a success, the dwarves were put to sleep by pixie magic. During a celebration that erupted around them, an elf used her magic to animate the oilcan in jest. Having come alive at a party, Squirt was imbued with the urge to seek out fun wherever it can be found.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "Why do something yourself when you can have someone else do it for you?"

items.name: Ideal
entries: "No use sitting about getting rusty when there's fun to be had. Let's party!"

items.name: Bond
entries: "I'm running on fumes here. I need oil."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm too tired to fly today. You carry me."

card.name: Stagefright the Goblin
entries: CHAPTER 4: YON
This goblin's real name is Onk. He oversees the goblin laborers who work behind the scenes at Motherhorn. He also serves as the theater's master of ceremonies.

Stagefright carries a fool's scepter topped with a visage similar to his, and he talks to the inanimate scepter as if it were alive (which it is not). Arguments between the two—or, more precisely, Stagefright and himself—always end with Stagefright bashing the scepter's head against something hard.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "My scepter would have you believe it can do a better job than I can, but time and again, I prove it wrong."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Chaos! I thrive in it."

items.name: Bond
entries: "The stage is my world. Without it, I wither."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I treat everyone like props."

card.name: Thaco the Clown
entries: CHAPTER 1: WITCHLIGHT CARNIVAL

Thaco is the longest-serving Witchlight hand, but no one really knows his history and scarcely any dare to ask, for he almost never speaks and harbors a malicious streak that is kept in check by Mister Witch. He paints his face with a grin and puffs on a bubble pipe. Thaco has retired from performing and no longer stages his knife-throwing act due to an unfortunate incident that took place in the Big Top some time ago.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I prefer not to talk. When I must, I say as little as possible."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Everyone should mind their own business."

items.name: Bond
entries: "My bubble pipe—if anyone touches it, they lose a finger."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't stand children. They're like roaches."

card.name: Thinnings the Butler
entries: CHAPTER 5: PALACE OF HEART'S DESIRE

Zybilna's butler appears as a lanky man clad in faded brown clothes. Thinnings longs to see Prismeer's archfey freed from temporal stasis and her enemies fed their comeuppance. He helps anyone whose goals align with his own, but he abhors violence and shuns combat.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I crave secrets."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Hospitality, ownership, reciprocity—the rules of conduct must be respected."

items.name: Bond
entries: "I have pledged my fealty to Zybilna of Prismeer, and I am nothing if not her loyal servant."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "Don't expect me to come to your rescue. I didn't get this far by being brave or foolhardy."

card.name: Vansel the Satyr
entries: CHAPTER 2: HITHER

The satyr Vansel is a vagabond who travels the Feywild in a constant state of amusement at whatever befalls him. He enjoys bathing and splashing in water, picking flowers, and eating wild mushrooms. He has no shame with regard to who he is and what he looks like, and he has a knack for small talk, reveling in the opportunity to chat with anyone about anything.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "Nothing dampens my spirits."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "There's fun and delight to be found in every experience."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Wonders abound in the Feywild, and I would never dream of leaving it."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I laugh in the face of danger, often to my detriment."

card.name: Will of the Feywild
entries: CHAPTER 3: THITHER

Will looks like an 11-year-old lad dressed in a homemade tunic and a spider silk cloak. He is the polymorphed form of an oni named Mugan, who served Granny Nightshade until a curse changed his alignment from lawful evil to chaotic good. Will's time in the forests of Thither has imbued him with a personality common among fairykind: boastful, impulsive, and full of mirth.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic good.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I like to strike a different pose with every sentence I speak."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "Every child must dash free and wild, like me!"

items.name: Bond
entries: "For the Getaway Gang to flourish, we need more members. Not adults, mind you, just kids like me!"

items.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm as stubborn and slippery as a toad. I won't and I shan't, but I will if I can't!"

card.name: Zybilna of Prismeer
entries: CHAPTER 5: PALACE OF HEART'S DESIRE

Iggwilv was a brilliant, calculating figure hardly prone to emotional outbursts, but as Zybilna, she allows her emotions to run rampant and is more likely to find herself in the grip of happiness, anger, or melancholy. This is the price she pays to exert control over the Feywild and impose her will on the domain of Prismeer.

items.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic neutral.

items.name: Personality Trait
entries: "I have become more temperamental in my old age."

items.name: Ideal
entries: "I used to believe that emotions and kindness were signs of weakness. Now I see their strength."

items.name: Bond
entries: "Prismeer is my home now."

items.name: Flaw
entries: "My mother, Baba Yaga, warned me that arrogance would be my undoing, 'as sure as stars light the night sky.' She might be right."

card.name: Arcturiadoom
entries: One of Halaster's apprentices was a human transmuter named Arcturia, who created all manner of new monsters and often made herself the subject of her own horrid magical transformations. She claimed an entire level of Undermountain as her lair and polymorphed prisoners into monsters to guard it. It's likely that Arcturia resides in Undermountain still, in one form or another.

card.name: Dark Elf Menace
entries: Recent conflicts in Menzoberranzan have left weakened drow houses fearing for their future. Drow are coming to Undermountain in droves to carve out sanctuaries for one house or another. Halaster can't be happy to see them return in force, but who knows? Maybe the Mad Mage orchestrated the upheaval to bring the dark elves scurrying back for reasons beyond the comprehension of the sane.

card.name: Death Tyrant
entries: The Mad Mage has transformed an entire level of Undermountain into a proving ground for adventurers who seek to reach the deepest layers of the dungeon and the treasures hidden within. At the end of this underground obstacle course waits the greatest challenge of all: Netherskull the Death Tyrant, an undead beholder that hates wizards above all.

card.name: Dwarfcraft
entries: Much of Undermountain was built long ago by the shield dwarves of the Melairkyn clan. These dwarves were masters of stonework and hid many of their rooms behind secret doors. They also dug deep in search of precious metals. These mines were later stripped by duergar invaders, leaving a maze of worthless tunnels and cav- erns for monsters to inhabit.

card.name: Emerald Blade
entries: Waterdeep was erected atop the bones of a dwarven kingdom built on the dust of a much older elven kingdom. It is said that a relic of the elves still waits to be found in Undermountain: a magic sword so sharp that its edge can slice through stone. Many adventurers have vanished during their hunt for the weapon, which, it is said, the elves blessed with the heart of a warrior and the soul of a poet.

card.name: Gith Who's Coming to Dinner?
entries: Githyanki have invaded Undermountain. Perhaps they seek to destroy a mind flayer colony hidden in the depths of the dungeon, or perhaps they are planning to attack and plunder Waterdeep. There's one other possibility: the githyanki might be building a creche—a stronghold away from the timeless Astral Plane where they can raise their young and train them in the art of war.

card.name: Guild of Many Eyes
entries: A thieves' guild that was driven from Waterdeep long ago still lurks in Undermountain, waiting and scheming to win back power in the city above. These villains make the sewers unsafe for honest folk to venture into. They have recently taken over Skullport, a subterranean town connected to Undermountain.

card.name: Immortal Insanity
entries: The Mad Mage of Undermountain has destroyed himself or been destroyed many times, but his demise is always short-lived. Folk say the dungeon cannot exist without him, and so it magically re-creates the archmage whenever he meets his end within its crumbling halls. Each time Halaster returns, less of his sanity remains.

card.name: Mad House
entries: The Shadowdusks were a Waterdavian noble family whose quest for political supremacy ended centuries ago after Shadowdusk wizards opened portals to the Far Realm. Twisted by madness and driven from their home, they sought assistance from Halaster and sank into the depths of Undermountain, never to be seen again—yet vestiges of the noble house undoubtedly remain.

card.name: Nester's Fate
entries: Halaster brought seven apprentices with him to Undermountain. One of them, Nester, became a lich using spells and methods of his own devising. But his process was flawed, and over time Nester's phylactery and body disintegrated until only his floating skull and skeletal arms remained. Driven mad by his failure to achieve true lichdom, Nester continues to haunt Undermountain in this weakened form.

card.name: Scavenger
entries: The Sea of Swords has borne its share of pirate ships, none stranger than the {@i Scavenger}. This vessel could travel below the waves and through the air. No one has seen it in years. Perhaps it sank or was lost in the starry maelstrom of the night sky, but divination spells suggest it found its way into Undermountain. Others have searched for it below Waterdeep, but no one has found it and lived to tell the tale.

card.name: School of Magic
entries: Rumor has it that a wizards' academy has opened on one of Undermountain's levels. It's not known who runs this academy—perhaps one of Halaster's apprentices or the Mad Mage himself—but many mages have been drawn down to it. What wizard wouldn't want to glimpse the powerful magic gathering dust in the depths of Undermountain?

card.name: Skullport
entries: Skullport overlooks the Sargauth River, a watery thoroughfare that cuts through the third level of Undermountain. Pirates once used the subterranean settlement as a trade port, but now it's a monster-infested haunt where spies and assassins hone their craft. Beware the fortress overlooking the river! Its garrison is commanded by an evil knight with a wyvern mount.

card.name: Spire and Snail
entries: Deep within Undermountain is a vast cavern containing a giant stalagmite that has been hollowed out to serve as a wizard's tower, perhaps even a refuge for the Mad Mage himself. The tower is guarded by stone constructs. No one knows what dwells inside. Not far from this tower lurks a most peculiar creature: a giant snail with a shell of pure gold.

card.name: Tangled Web
entries: Secret temples exist in great numbers in Undermountain, particularly those of evil gods not welcomed in the city above. The vile servants of these deities are locked in an endless war for supremacy in the dark dungeon. Lolth, the Demon Queen of Spiders, is the fiendish mastermind behind many of these bloody conflicts.

card.name: Trobriand's Army
entries: Trobriand was one of Halaster's most promising and demented apprentices. Fascinated by machines, he carved out a level of the Mad Mage's dungeon for himself and set to work building an army of constructs there. It is said that Trobriand controls his creations with a metal ring, and that he crafted similar rings of lesser power for his apprentices, to protect them in the event that his constructs went insane.

card.name: Underground Forest
entries: The River of the Depths connects the fourth and fifth levels of Undermountain, skirting the edges of vast caverns filled with trees, shrubs, birds, other animals, and sunlight. An entire forest, as real as any found on the surface, waits to be explored, but an archdruid protects it. And explorers traveling downriver have seen a huge green dragon as well, perched on a tower near a bridge that spans the river.

card.name: What Drow Fear
entries: Part of Undermountain was carved out by the drow. Muiral, said to be a former bodyguard and apprentice of Halaster's, claims this domain and hunts trespass- ers for sport. These halls are littered with the bones of the slaughtered. Even the dark elves speak of Muiral in hushed tones. Anyone who can terrify the drow should be avoided at all costs.

card.name: Donnabella Fiasco
entries: {@i Human Spellcaster}
Donnabella is a young magic-user who wears a papier-mch unicorn mask because it makes her feel more magical.
Use the {@creature Spellcaster|ESK} sidekick stat block to represent her.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "I'd rather talk to a book than most people."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "We all have a little magic in us. The trick is finding it and bringing it forth."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I want to join a prestigious wizards' academy one day. I just hope they accept unicorns!"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't keep a secret to save my life—or anyone else's."

card.name: Galandro Luna
entries: {@i Human Expert}
Galandro's most treasured possession is a fiddle that he tunes and plucks constantly.
Use the {@creature Expert|ESK} sidekick stat block to represent him.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "I love a good insult, even one directed at me."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I like seeing the smiles on people's faces when I perform. That plus their adoration is all that matters."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My fiddle was gifted to me by a good friend. I cherish it above all other things."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I'll do anything to win fame and renown."

card.name: Inverna Nightbreeze
entries: {@i Moon Elf Warrior}
Inverna has a scar on her cheek where she was grazed by an orc's javelin. She is cautious by nature and suspicious of strangers.
Use the {@creature Warrior|ESK} sidekick stat block to represent her.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "I choose my words very carefully. Sarcasm, I'm told, is my sharpest weapon."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "All people deserve to be treated with dignity, regardless of their station. Of course, orcs aren't people."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "Orcs are a blight on the land. For the sake of the natural and civilized worlds, I kill them on sight."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't admit when I'm wrong."

card.name: Nib Addlespur
entries: {@i Lightfoot Halfling Spellcaster}
Nib is a happy-go-lucky gambler who keeps a deck of Three-Dragon Ante cards in her vest pocket. She also has a goldfinch named Lil.
Use the {@creature Spellcaster|ESK} sidekick stat block to represent her.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "I can't resist a sure bet or a friendly wager."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "The more complicated the scheme, the better."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I love birds and will do what I can to look after them."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "Deep water terrifies me. I would rather be swallowed by a dragon than get in a boat or go for a swim."

card.name: Pickled Pete
entries: {@i Human Expert}
Pete likes ale and tends to function better while tipsy. At his best, he's quite the handyman and comes up with all sorts of crazy ways to get things done.
Use the {@creature Expert|esk} sidekick stat block to represent him.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I like coming up with new ways to do things. What problem can't be solved with a little ingenuity?"

entries.name: Bond
entries: "A full flask of wine is worth ten pockets full of gold."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "All this drinking is bad for my memory. Seriously, I can't remember my last name."

card.name: Quinn Hightopple
entries: {@i Lightfoot Halfling Warrior}
Quinn is a happy little scrapper who likes to punch people in the groin.
Use the {@creature Warrior|esk} sidekick stat block to represent him.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "Nice set of teeth you got there. Be a shame if something bad happened to 'em."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "No challenge is too big to overcome. As Papa Bartho always says, the bigger they are, the harder they fall."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "Nothing's more important than friendship. That's why I'll never leave a friend behind."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I can't resist punching tall folk in the groin. I call it the Halfling Hello."

card.name: Ruby Hammerwhacker
entries: {@i Shield Dwarf Warrior}
Ruby lacks the customary dwarven stoicism and greets every day with a warm smile and a renewed sense of optimism.
Use the {@creature Warrior|esk} sidekick stat block to represent her.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "We should all seek the betterment of ourselves. There's always room for improvement."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: ""Tell me I can't do something, and I must prove you wrong."

card.name: Shanjan Kwan
entries: {@i Human Spellcaster}
Kwan died and was raised from the dead as an infant, whereupon a tiny black glyph—the symbol of necromancy—appeared on his forehead.
Use the {@creature Spellcaster|esk} sidekick stat block to represent him.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "I've cheated death once. I can do it again."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Great beauty can hide great ugliness. The reverse is also true."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a simple question: Am I a god?"

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I don't like mysteries. Unraveling them keeps me up at night."

card.name: Talon Thornwild
entries: {@i Human Expert}
Talon loves gold and adventure, and dreams of being a famous gold prospector.
Use the {@creature Expert|esk} sidekick stat block to represent them.

entries.name: Personality
entries: "Yes, I eat like a pig and have bad manners, but those are my only flaws, I swear. I'm darn near perfect otherwise."

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I like gold. I like its color, its texture, its majestic gleam."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else."

card.name: Abjurer
entries: Those guided by logic and reasoning; warns of an overlooked clue or piece of information

card.name: Anarchist
entries: A fundamental change brought on by one whose beliefs are being put to the test

card.name: Artifact
entries: The importance of some physical object that must be obtained, protected, or destroyed at all costs

card.name: Avenger
entries: Justice and revenge for great wrongs; those on a quest to rid the world of great evil

card.name: Beast
entries: Great rage or passion; something bestial or malevolent hiding in plain sight or lurking just below the surface

card.name: Beggar
entries: Sudden change in economic status or fortune

card.name: Berserker
entries: The brutal and barbaric side of warfare; bloodlust; those with a bestial nature

card.name: Bishop
entries: Strict adherence to a code or a belief; those who plot, plan, and scheme

card.name: Broken One
entries: Defeat, failure, and despair; the loss of something or someone important, without which one feels incomplete

card.name: Charlatan
entries: Liars; those who profess to believe one thing but actually believe another

card.name: Conjurer
entries: The coming of an unexpected supernatural threat; those who think of themselves as gods

card.name: Darklord
entries: A single, powerful individual of an evil nature, one whose goals have enormous and far-reaching consequences

card.name: Dictator
entries: All that is wrong with government and leadership; those who rule through fear and violence

card.name: Diviner
entries: The pursuit of knowledge tempered by wisdom; truth and honesty; sages and prophecy

card.name: Donjon
entries: Isolation and imprisonment; being so conservative in thinking as to be a prisoner of one's own beliefs

card.name: Druid
entries: The ambivalence and cruelty of nature and those who feel drawn to it; inner turmoil

card.name: Elementalist
entries: The triumph of nature over civilization; natural disasters and bountiful harvests

card.name: Enchanter
entries: Inner turmoil that comes from confusion, fear of failure, or false information

card.name: Evoker
entries: Magical or supernatural power that can't be controlled; magic for destructive ends

card.name: Executioner
entries: The imminent death of one rightly or wrongly convicted of a crime; false accusations and unjust prosecution

card.name: Ghost
entries: The looming past; the return of an old enemy or the discovery of a secret buried long ago

card.name: Guild Member
entries: Like-minded individuals joined together in a common goal; pride in one's work

card.name: Healer
entries: Healing; a contagious illness, disease, or curse; those who practice the healing arts

card.name: Hooded One
entries: Bigotry, intolerance, and xenophobia; a mysterious presence or newcomer

card.name: Horseman
entries: Death; disaster in the form of the loss of wealth or property, a horrible defeat, or the end of a bloodline

card.name: Illusionist
entries: Lies and deceit; grand conspiracies; secret societies; the presence of a dupe or a saboteur

card.name: Innocent
entries: A being of great importance whose life is in danger (who might be helpless or simply unaware of the peril)

card.name: Marionette
entries: The presence of a spy or a minion of some greater power; an encounter with a puppet or an underling

card.name: Mercenary
entries: Inner strength and fortitude; those who fight for power or wealth

card.name: Merchant
entries: A rare commodity or business opportunity; deceitful or dangerous business transactions

card.name: Miser
entries: Hoarded wealth; those who are irreversibly unhappy or who think money is meaningless

card.name: Missionary
entries: Those who spread wisdom and faith to others; warnings of the spread of fear and ignorance

card.name: Mists
entries: Something unexpected or mysterious that can't be avoided; a great quest or journey that will try one's spirit

card.name: Monk
entries: Serenity; inner strength and self-reliance; supreme confidence bereft of arrogance

card.name: Myrmidon
entries: Great heroes; a sudden reversal of fate; the triumph of the underdog over a mighty enemy

card.name: Necromancer
entries: Unnatural events and unhealthy obsessions; those who follow a destructive path

card.name: Paladin
entries: Just and noble warriors; those who live by a code of honor and integrity

card.name: Philanthropist
entries: Charity and giving on a grand scale; those who use wealth to fight evil and sickness

card.name: Priest
entries: Enlightenment; those who follow a deity, a system of values, or a higher purpose

card.name: Raven
entries: A hidden source of information; a fortunate turn of events; a secret potential for good

card.name: Rogue
entries: Anyone for whom money is important; those who believe money is the key to their success

card.name: Seer
entries: Inspiration and keen intellect; a future event, the outcome of which will hinge on a clever mind

card.name: Shepherd
entries: Those who protect others; one who bears a burden far too great to be shouldered alone

card.name: Soldier
entries: War and sacrifice; the stamina to endure great hardship

card.name: Swashbuckler
entries: Those who like money yet give it up freely; likable rogues and rapscallions

card.name: Tax Collector
entries: Corruption; honesty in an otherwise corrupt government or organization

card.name: Tempter
entries: One who has been compromised or led astray by temptation or foolishness; one who tempts others for evil ends

card.name: Thief
entries: Those who steal or burgle; a loss of property, beauty, innocence, friendship, or reputation

card.name: Torturer
entries: The coming of suffering or merciless cruelty; one who is irredeemably evil or sadistic

card.name: Trader
entries: Commerce; smuggling and black markets; fair and equitable trades

card.name: Traitor
entries: Betrayal by someone close and trusted; a weakening or loss of faith

card.name: Transmuter
entries: A new discovery; the coming of unexpected things; unforeseen consequences and chaos

card.name: Warrior
entries: Strength and force personified; violence; those who use force to accomplish their goals

card.name: Wizard
entries: Mystery and riddles; the unknown; those who crave magical power and great knowledge

card.name: I'jin
entries: {@i (pronounced EYE-jin)}
I'jin the {@creature Almiraj|ToA}, is fickle and unpredictable.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by I'jin, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I never stick to a plan."

entries.name: Power
entries: While I'jin inhabits you, your Dexterity score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

card.name: Kubazan
entries: {@i (pronounced KOO-bah-zahn)}
Kubazan the {@creature Froghemoth|VGM}, is wild and spirited.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Kubazan, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I am fearless and not afraid to take great risks."

entries.name: Power
entries: While Kubazan inhabits you, your Strength score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

card.name: Moa
entries: {@i (pronounced MOH-ah)}
Moa the {@creature Jaculi|ToA}, is truthful and kind.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Moa, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I must always speak the truth."

entries.name: Power
entries: While inhabited by Moa, you can use an action to turn {@condition invisible}. Anything you are wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on your person. The effect ends if you attack, cast a spell, force a saving throw, or deal damage.

card.name: Nangnang
entries: {@i (pronounced NANG-nang)}
Nangnang the {@creature Grung|VGM}, is selfish and cruel.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Nangnang, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I won't share with others."

entries.name: Power
entries: While inhabited by Nangnang, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

card.name: Obo'laka
entries: {@i (pronounced oh-boh-LAH-kah)}
Obo'laka the {@creature Zorbo|ToA}, is nervous and obsessive.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Obo'laka, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I am risk-averse and a slave to routine."

entries.name: Power
entries: While Obo'laka inhabits you, you can attune to one additional magic item. When Obo'laka leaves you, all magic items to which you are attuned are no longer attuned to you.

card.name: Papazotl
entries: {@i (pronounced pah-pah-ZAH-tul)}
Papazotl the {@creature Eblis|ToA}, is shrewd and conniving.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Papazotl, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I bow before no one and expect others to do as I command."

entries.name: Power
entries: While inhabited by Papazotl, you can't be surprised, you gain advantage on all Wisdom checks, and you never take damage from falling.

card.name: Shagambi
entries: {@i (pronounced shah-GOM-bee)}
Shagambi the {@creature Kamadan|ToA}, is wise and virtuous.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Shagambi, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I never show mercy to evildoers."

entries.name: Power
entries: While inhabited by Shagambi, you can make one extra attack when taking the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

card.name: Unkh
entries: {@i (pronounced UNK)}
Unkh the {@creature Flail Snail|VGM}, is self-absorbed and indecisive.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Unkh, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I am incapable of making decisions."

entries.name: Power
entries: While Unkh inhabits you, your Constitution score becomes 23 unless it is already higher.

card.name: Wongo
entries: {@i (pronounced WONG-go)}
Wongo the {@creature Su-monster|ToA}, is violent and deranged.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: While inhabited by Wongo, you gain the following flaw, which overrides any opposing flaw: "I act without concern for the well-being of others."

entries.name: Power
entries: While inhabited by Wongo, you can use your action to unleash a psionic assault on a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
